action.action-desc: Ms. Waters (for herself, Mr. Connolly, Mrs. McIver, Ms. Brownley, Mr. Frost, Ms. Matsui, Ms. Norton, Ms. Ocasio-Cortez, Ms. Tlaib, and Ms. Tokuda) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide that a rule relating to a reduction in force is subject to review under chapter 8 of that title, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reduction in Force Review Act.

section.header: Congressional review of agency reductions in force
section.text: Chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (ii), by striking and at the end;
in clause (iii), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: if the rule relates to a reduction in force at the Federal agency that is authorized under subchapter I of chapter 35, a detailed justification for the reduction in force, which shall include—

subclause.text: the specific reasons for the reduction in force;
the anticipated impact of the reduction in force on the employees and operations of the Federal agency;
any alternatives to the reduction in force that the Federal agency considered, including the reasons that the Federal agency rejected those alternatives;
a summary of the consultations that the Federal agency has held with—

item.text: employees of the Federal agency who will be affected by the reduction in force; and
representatives of the employees described in item (aa); and

subclause.text: a summary of how the reduction in force will impact employees of the Federal agency who are veterans.

paragraph.text: by amending section 804(3) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: has the meaning given the term in section 551; and

clause.text: a rule or order relating to a reduction in force at a Federal agency that is authorized under subchapter I of chapter 35; and

any significant action by a Federal agency that substantially affects the rights or obligations of non-Federal agency parties, such as a workforce restructuring, office closure, or other action by a Federal agency that has a material impact on the employees or operations of the Federal agency.
